Open your mind with books

Read to know we are not alone.

I like to read books in applied maths, sciences, biography, history and psychology. Check my activities on Goodreads (to-read books, comments, ratings,…) for more information.

  • I'm reading Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and Tensorflow: Concepts, Tools, and Techniques to Build Intelligent Systems — Aurélien Géron.
  • I'm reading Factfulness: Ten Reasons We're Wrong About the World – and Why Things Are Better Than You Think — Hans Rosling, Ola Rosling, Anna Rosling Rönnlund.
  • my choice The Godfather — Mario Puzo.
  • The ABC Murders — Agatha Christie. When Alice Asher is murdered in Andover, Hercule Poirot is already on to the clues. Alphabetically speaking, it's one down, twenty-five to go.
  • Inside the Minds of Serial Killers: Why They Kill — Katherine Ramsland.
  • The Boy in the Striped Pajamas — Jostein Gaarder.
  • my choice Con đường Hồi giáo — Nguyễn Phương Mai.
  • South of the Border, West of the Sun — Haruki Murakami.
  • Think like a freak — Steven D. Levitt. The New York Times bestselling Freakonomics changed the way we see the world, exposing the hidden side of just about everything.
  • Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow — Yuval Noah Harari. The next book of Harari after his Sapiens.
  • Oxford thương yêu — Dương Thụy.
  • my choice Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind — Yuval Noah Harari. Go through the history of human from the first individuals to walk the earth to the radical.
  • Tâm nguyện cuối cùng — Mi Lei. The newest detective novel from Mi Lei. This time, he focused heavily on the stories of each character. There are still twists but they're quite easy to guess.
  • Hiệu ứng chim mồi — Quốc Khánh, Hạo Nhiên. With a simple and witty writing style, the authors show us some useful psychological techniques for business.
  • Papillon — Henri Charrière. An awesome adventure of Charrière when he tried to escape from all prisons he is confined.
  • Hắn và thằng bạn — Quốc Khánh, Hạo Nhiên.
  • Edison as I know him — Henry Ford, Samuel Crowther.
  • my choice To Kill a Mockingbird — Harper Lee.
  • Predictably Irrational: The Hidden Forces That Shape Our Decisions — Dan Ariely.
  • Blink: The Power of Thinking Without Thinking — Malcolm Gladwell.
  • Bức xúc không làm ta vô can — Đặng Hoàng Giang.
  • The Murder of Roger Ackroyd — Agatha Christie.
  • Le Petit Nicolas — Sempé - Goscinny.
  • When he comes, close your eyes — Ding Mo.
  • my choice Einstein: His Life and Universe — Walter Isaacson.
  • Man's Search for Meaning — Viktor Emil Frankl.
  • my choice The Code Book: The Science of Secrecy from Ancient Egypt to Quantum Cryptography — Simon Singh.
  • How to stop Worrying and start living — Dale Carnegie.
  • Lần đầu thấy trăng — Võ Diệu Thanh.
  • The Alchemist — Paulo Coelho.
  • Letters to a young mathematician — Ian Stewart.
  • my choice The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business — Charles Duhigg.
  • Love and Math: The Heart of Hidden Reality — Edward Frenkel.
  • The call of the wild — Jack London.
  • White Fang — Jack London.
  • The housekeeper and the professor — Yoko Ogawa.
  • Harry Potter (7 books) — J.K. Rowling.
